metadata.title: CVE-2023-42115 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Exim AUTH Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. Thisvulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affectedinstallations of Exim. Authentication is not required to exploit thisvulnerability.The specific flaw exists within the smtp service, which listens on TCP port25 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper validation ofuser-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of a buffer.An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the contextof the service account. Was ZDI-CAN-17434.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-base - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-config - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
exim4-daemon-light - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
eximon4 - 4.93-13ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.93-13ubuntu1.8').
